text: hi my name is Rebecca and in today's
lesson we're going to be talking about
money and subject which is obviously
very popular and we have a number of
words which we use a number of verbs
which we use when we talk about money
let's discuss ten of these okay so let's
start over here what can you do with
money these are ten different activities
that you can do with money you could
deposit the money in the bank which
means to put your money in the bank to
deposit your money you could take your
money out of the bank for that we say we
draw your money I can we draw my life
you could transfer it that means move it
from one place to another place I
transfer my money from my checking
account to my savings account now I use
the past tense we'll go back and use the
past tense
afterwards for all of them okay you can
save your money which is of course a
very good idea if you're able to do that
you can borrow money if you don't have
enough money sometimes you have to
borrow money from a friend or from the
bank if you borrow money that means you
take it temporarily with the intention
with the plan of giving it back then you
borrow it and whoever gave it to
temporarily they are lending it to you
so you could say the bank lends money
customers borrow money alright if you
borrow money from the bank let's say
then you owe money oh w/e it means that
you have a debt to the bank and you need
to return that money to the bank usually
plus some interest some extra
amount that you need to pay in order to
have the right to borrowings so you owe
money to the bank of course we all know
how to spend our money alright when you
go shopping you spend your money if you
spend too much money on something we
could say you wasted your money that
means you didn't need to spend that much
money for something then we say he
wasted his money of course you could be
a little bit wiser or if you are in a
position where you have extra money you
could decide to invest your money invest
your money in a business invest your
money in the stock market and so on okay
so here are 10 words that you can use
when you're talking about this important
subject of money let's review them again
and let's use the past tense form this
time I deposited the check I withdrew
$500 I transfer $1,000 from my checking
account to my savings account I saved a
thousand dollars this month
I borrowed ten dollars from my friend
the bank lent me money
as a down payment on my house they lent
me LP NT he owed the bank a lot of money
he spent a lot of money he wasted a lot
of money on that television let's say or
he invested in the stock market we
invested in the stock market as you can
see some of these are regular verbs
where we added
D or D and some are irregular verbs
where we had to change the ending of the
verb to form the past tense form alright
one last point about this word we draw
in North America we say we draw and in
England in British English they say just
draw so they say I drew some money from
the bank and in North America we say aye
we drew some money from the bank okay so
now I hope you have ten new words and
perhaps 20 along with the past tense

regarding money if you have any
